data.title: Resting on their laurels, perhaps?  Glitches with reserved room block and credit card charge
data.text:
Let me preface this by saying we were given some Hyatt points in recognition of the challenges we experienced, which is appreciated. However, I feel it is my responsibility to make others aware of some of the glitches so they can be extra vigilant if they do choose the Hyatt for their guests.  The Hyatt Regency knows it is the only game downtown to host events of a certain size, so perhaps the market competition is not there to motivate them step up their game.  But judging by the Trip Advisor reviews of late, and our experience, it does need to step up its game.  Does it want to be known as a tired-looking hotel with hit and miss service, or as the top of the brand? 

We booked a block of rooms for our event guests.  There were many glitches with the block.  I'm not sure if this is a technology issue on Hyatt's part, lack of communication between departments, or user error.  I know of at least one guest who used the designated link to book the block rate yet got the regular rate.  This was fixed but indicates, as with some of the other glitches, that the block was never properly designated.  Then the block was closed prematurely--the contract stipulated that we had up to a certain number of nights, yet when less nights had been booked than the number specified in the contract,  we were told it was closed.  My husband essentially got a blank stare / brick wall when he kept asking about the number promised in the contract to the group sales represenative.  Also, some of the people who booked through the block did not get their welcome bags.  Look, we know Tulsa is not a top-choice destination, and thus we were serious about "wowing our guests."  We put much effort and money into some very nice gift bags--wine, gourmet candy, personal notes.  We were told some of the bags had not been distributed because some of the block rooms had not been coded properly. 

There was also a credit card charge error.  Friends hosted a catered event at the hotel.  This was a gift to us and was to be billed to them, of course, since it was a gift (a very, very nice one!)   Well, we got the charge for the catered event on our own credit card. This was awkward because the hosts never intended for us to know how much the event had cost.  How did this even happen?  The person in customer service with whom we first tried to resolve it kept saying, "you signed a contract."  Yes, we signed a contract for the guest room block, not the hosted event.  That event was a separate contract.  So how did the charge for one contract get associated with the other contract?  Back to my original question--outdated technology, lack of communication between departments, or user error?

I am confident that the Hyatt can do better.  I hope that they will identify and fix any underlying problems that contributed to these mistakes so that they do not happen again.

data.title: Bed bugs in room
data.text: Bed bugs in one bed. Called the front desk for a manager was told one was not available and was tansfered to a voice mail and told he would call me back. 24 hours later still no call back. This is very sad considering I have never had any issues with this property before.

data.title: NOT a Regency experience!
data.text: Hotel rooms are fine and quiet. Service leaves much to be desired, at least in my experience. Price is right, but one shouldn't have to deal with shuttle not picking one up, food not what we ordered, and double charges upon checkout.

data.title: Nice one night stay for concert
data.text: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency Downtown Tulsa one night to attend the Billy Joel concert at the BOK center (only a 2 block walk from the hotel).  Their free shuttle picked us up at the airport and took us back then next day.  The drivers were professional and very courteous.  They are also helpful and knowledgeable.  Every staff member we saw spoke and was friendly.  The hotel lobby (both upstairs and downstairs) is welcoming and easy to navigate due to good signage.  Our 2 queen bed room was on the 4th floor overlooking a lovely little park.  While the bathroom was a bit small, it was well laid out and very clean with wonderfully fluffy and largish towels and washcloths.  The beds were comfortable, though I'd have preferred an assortment of pillows rather than all down.  There was only one chair, the desk/ office chair, but there were nice benches at the end of each bed which made dressing easier.  They had signs up in the lobby indicating that they are about to start room refurbishment.  The furniture did look a bit worn, but not really bad and the painted walls were a lovely soft yellow (I prefer painted walls to wallpaper which shows dirt and often peels) and loved the art deco styling. Also, the room was very quiet.  We really felt well cared for and comfortable.  We will be watching for future concerts at BOK due to enjoying our stay here so much.

data.title: Excellent Stay
data.text: I stayed here on a business trip and the staff was super nice. My schedule was super hectic for the week I was here so, it was appreciated that the room was extremely clean and quiet and I was able to get some good sleep. I will certainly stay here again on my next trip!

data.title: Super stay
data.text: Everything about this stay was perfect. The staff was super friendly, helpful and accommodating! It Started w a shuttle trip from the airport which was super quick to pick us up and take us to the hotel. Check in was smooth, easy and they gave us a discount sheet to use at the Aveda Salon (which I did👍). The room was clean and comfortable. We also used the complimentary shuttle service to get into town for dinner and shopping. Lucas the Bellman was awesome! He was A wealth of information about the city, history and full of fabulous restaurant recommendations!!!!would definitely stay here again!!!!!

data.title: HYATT Tulsa
data.text: Great hotel. Comfortable beds. Clean quiet rooms. Good food in the restaurant great location right downtown Tulsa 20 minutes from the airport. 20 minutes to Sand Springs. Located in walking distance to lots of restaurants and bars.

data.title: Wasps
data.text:
Had wasps in the room. Changed rooms and could see more trying to get in.
Daily grill restaurant overpriced for the quality of the food.
The showers were great almost instant hot water.
Coffee pot makes only a single cup at a time and leaked

data.title: The great hotel in Tulsa  Okla.
data.text: This is a very nice hotel . The service, staff, rooms, food, is the best in Tulsa, Okla. Very clean and great people to work with. It is just a first class to stay or have a small or large meeting. Great Great  Great Great Great Great Great  Hotel and Staff.

data.title: Tulsa Hyatt Regency
data.text: Super professional staff.  I lost my suitcase and they did everything possible to recover it...and they did.  I was very impressed how hard they tried. Food and drinks in the hotel restaurant were good.

data.title: Excellent Hotel
data.text: Clean & spacious rooms.  Friendly and helpful staff.  The beds were wonderful.  Good temperature control.  The restaurant had great service and good food.  I would definitely recommend this hotel.  I have stayed here on several other occasions in the past few years.

data.title: Great Hotel
data.text: We stayed one night for the 2016 Tulsa Run. Staff was friendly and helpful. Facilities were clean and neat. Accessibility to parking, restaurants, etc. was great. We are already planning our next stay.

data.title: Below Expectations
data.text:
I'm a member of Hyatt Gold Passport and have stayed at some great Hyatt properties. I was very disappointed in my stay at the Hyatt Regency in Tulsa for several reasons:

Housekeeping was subpar. I'm all about saving linen but staying at a hotel, I'd expect linens to be changes at least once during a four night stay. That never happened. There were also many surfaces that needed a good wiping down. There's nothing worse (well I'm sure there is) than seeing secret drippings on vertical surfaces. 

Response time was extremely poor. I called the operator/guest services at least 5 times during my stay. A few times I had to call back because there was no answer. That's unacceptable. I called to request a wine opener and a toiletry. An hour later, I called back because no one had come. 

The furniture in the room was not in great condition. The leather chair looked as if Wolverine had taken to the seat cushion. The bench at the end of the bed was torn in at least 2 places. 

The building itself is just old. If you look at the trimming it looks like they just painted over very old wood. There was a suspicious black fuzz in the light fixture in the bathroom too. The headboard was made of linoleum flooring. It was odd. 

The one thing I'll say that was good about the stay was that I needed a microwave and they brought one up to the room. That was the highlight of my stay at the Hyatt Regency. They really need to step up their game.

data.title: Always nice
data.text: I've stayed at the downtown Hyatt several times and it's always nice. We had a newly renovated room and it was really nice. The bed linens were clean and the bed didn't smell funny, the carpet was nice and clean too. I look forward to visiting again soon.

data.title: Don't stay here
data.text: Don't worry about sleeping in the maids will bust your door down at 8:30 am. And knock every half hour till you leave even when check out is at noon. Also the front desk will change the price at check and never look you in the eyes. Also check your card because my bill at check out isn't the same as my card was charged. Stay at your own risk!!!👎🏽👎🏽👎🏽👎🏽👎🏽👎🏽

data.title: Good Hotel
data.text: The Hyatt Regency is clean, well run and staffed with friendly, attentive people who do their best to accommodate your needs. The bed was comfortable, with multiple pillows and good blankets. The location in downtown made it very convenient to walk to multiple restaurants. The free shuttle was a great plus - you can take it one way or round trip to a restaurant within the downtown area.

data.title: First class stay
data.text: My overall stay at the Tulsa Hyatt Regency was excellent.  The room was clean and comfortable.  The staff was friendly and professional.  The location was convenient to my associated business in town.  Even though it was downtown, parking was convenient and easy.

data.title: Expensive
data.text:
Stayed for just over a week for a convention....  had a great time at the convention, plenty of rooms, staff was nice, etc.

But for the hotel stay, so not worth the price.  No free parking, and internet was not free.  But they did provide password and parking pass.  

They do provide free 'if you forgot' things like toothpaste, toothbrush, hairspray, sewing kit, etc.
They will also provide a microwave upon request, and availability.

data.title: A very nice hotel at a reasonable price
data.text: The hotel has very nice rooms, an indoor swimming pool, excellent service and a good restaurant as well as valet or self parking. The rooms are comfortable and the hotel is centrally located. The hotel has excellent shuttle service to and from the airport. Its the fourth year we have stayed at the hotel in conjunction with the Tulsa run. It is only a few bliocks away from the start of the race

data.title: Bad
data.text: Reception and room service NEVER answer the phone - even when they ask you to call the reception they won't pick up. Staff looks friendly but never helps with your requests : I asked for extra blankets that were never delivered to my room. Food is overall mediocre.
